results.title: Conservation school. No. 4. Soil and water conservation
results.creator_credit: Carl Pryer Jr and United States. Soil Conservation Service
results.brief_description: This film shows briefly how conservation farming methods may prevent further destruction of the nation’s soil and water resources. It emphasises that proper land use is the basis of conservation farming, and shows how several of the best common conservation practices are applied to land, eg contouring, terracing, strip-cropping, cover-cropping, rotation, and tree and grass planting.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Carl Pryer Jr and United States. Soil Conservation Service

results.title: Conservation and our forests
results.brief_description: Explains why forests are a valuable natural resource. Tells how, through conservation, a continuing supply of wood products can be made available without destroying the forest. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Conquest of the rivers
results.creator_credit: H Malcolm and Snowy Mountains Authority
results.brief_description: Shows through the experiences of a new recruit to the Snowy Mountains Scheme how this great enterprise was carried out. There are dramatic scenes from inside the thirty-seven mile tunnel which is an essential feature of the work. Other views include the blasting of roads, dam-building, and the life of families in the new frontier towns of the Australian Alps. Uses archival footage.

results.title: Conquest
results.creator_credit: Harold L. Gray, Charles F. Banks, Reelcraft Productions and Rural Bank of New South Wales
results.brief_description: A rural bank manager and his new recruit on horseback visit a grazier who tells the story of claiming the land only to then suffer a drought causing loss to most of his stock. However his bank came to the rescue, providing him with enough money to carry on and buy new stock and equipment. A promotional film for the Rural Bank of New South Wales. Narrated by W. Lane-Bayliff

results.title: Conduction in P and N crystals
results.brief_description: Part two of the Semiconductor Physics series demonstrates how an extra free electron is introduced into a germanium crystal. One of the atoms having four valency electrons is replaced by a foreign atom having five valency electrons, such as an atom of antimony.

results.title: Condom sense
results.creator_credit: Steve Faigenbaum, Jim Locker and Cerberus Productions
results.brief_description: A very original, informative film aimed at encouraging men to take a more active role in contraception. Using comedy to dispel the myths and complaints associated with condom use, the film presents accurate information about birth control and opens up the issues of communication and responsibility in relationships.

results.title: Computer history digest: a chronicle of important events...
results.creator_credit: George Samson and Association for computing machinery
results.brief_description: Provides a brief historical overview of computers, with a focus on US achievements. Discusses punch card technology and the flexibility of plug boards. Shows the 1939 Worlds Fair showcasing future calculating devices and the ENIAC, designed by Eckert and Mauchly to compute World War II ballistic firing tables. Includes early 20th century footage of computers.

results.title: Communication and motivation: dealing successfully with today's students
results.brief_description: One of a series in which Dr William Glasser presents a problem solving approach for individuals in therapeutic situations and which can be applied to discipline in schools. Glasser combines his discussion of the Schools Without Failure concepts, and examines the ways in which motivation can be encouraged - laughter and fun, and the importance of self expression give a child recognition that will motivate him to work. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.
